inclusion.criterion: Newly diagnosed left ventricular dysfunction (LVEF ≤ 35% following cardioversion or rate stabilization)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: High burden of premature ventricular contractions (PVCs) (15% of total beats on 24-hour ambulatory Holter recording with a rapid ventricular response > 100 beats per minute prior to initiation of medical therapy)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Appropriate management during hospitalization with cardioversion and rhythm control (preferable) or rate control (if cardioversion is contraindicated due to a left atrial thrombus or is not successful)
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: HF likely due to an etiology other than tachyarrhythmia (ischemic etiology, myocarditis, hypertrophic or dilated cardiomyopathy, etc.)
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Unstable clinical condition, life threatening arrhythmia or an established indication for ICD/CRT-D implantation during the index hospitalization
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: Patient has history of CAD and prior MI, HLD, HTN, ventricular tachycardia, and syncope. He was recently discharged after a negative work-up for syncope which included the implantation of a cardiac monitoring device.
